list1dism wrote:
> 
> During some (not all) crawls the following message appears in the
> heritrix_out.log file:
> 
> SEVERE org.archive.crawler.frontier.HostQueuesFrontier wakeReadyQueues
> First() item couldn't be remove()d! -
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.KeyedQueue@14b52aa - false
> 
> When this happens the crawl stacks - doesn't download any more files
> and the aforementioned log file begins to get bigger and bigger
> reaching the size of some Gigabytes in a few minutes, logging a
> repetition of same messages about stats, queues and threads all ending
> with the above error message. And it  keeps on logging....
> 
> What can I do to avoid that?

This error indicates corruption in the data structure that holds
'snoozed' URI work queues. (That is, queues which are waiting a
specific period before their next URI is processed, to enforce a
politeness or error-retry delay.)

What version of Heritrix are you running, with what Java VM and OS?

Are you using any non-standard configuration options?

- Gordon @ IA
